page.title: 01Redditch New Town.
page.content: {Redditch}was designated a{New Town}in {1964}and was planned as a series of selfcontained "neighbourhoods".{Church {Hill}and{Winyates}are within our area. Houses and factories have been built to follow the lines of the landscape. Redditch has a road system built to link the estates with the town centre and beyond to{Birmingham}and the{M5 motorway at{Bromsgrove.}Redditch has the covered{Kingfisher Shopping Centre and a pedestrianized area, with access for the disabled around the dominant {St. Stephen's Church.}Each estate has an industrial area, a local shopping centre and schools. Over 700 acres have been set aside for the{Arrow {Valley Park}and a conservation area at {Ipsley Alders Marsh.}As much of the natural landscape has been preserved as possible and over 3 million new trees planted.
